diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +209,213 @@                                   out: Outlet[T],
                                   settings: JmsConsumerSettings,
                                   inheritedAttributes: Attributes)
    extends GraphStageLogic(shape)
    with JmsConsumerConnector

comments.body: Whose thread is blocked here? How many outstanding commits can it take?

This is the JMS session thread (which is blocking anyway... previously just on the blocking queue). The number of outstanding commits is the number of sessions we open.

In our production we do see anomalies and deviations from the JMS spec in edge cases when using the previous implementation of blocking queue. Switching to futures makes it more lenient to such anomalies and has 0 incidents over the past month. We could use either this or the Java `CompletableFuture`. Both cases we do block in similar fashion, though.
This is good. I covers both the success and failure cases and makes sure we close the connection in all cases.
